br.com.summa.sol.util

Class Nullables

  • java.lang.Object
    • br.com.summa.sol.util.Nullables

  • public final class Nullables
extends Object
    Convenience class for working with (possibly null) objects.

    This implementation does not use reflection, thus avoiding security restrictions and providing roughly the same performance as a "manual" implementation.
    Author:
    Einar Saukas

    • Method Detail

      • hashCode

        public static int hashCode(Object... objs)
        Calculates hashCode() for a sequence of (possibly null) objects.

        Typical usage:
         public class Example {
     private ... x;
     private ... y;
     private ... z;

     public int hashCode()
     {
         return Nullables.hashCode(x, y, z);
     }
 }

      • equals

        public static <T> boolean equals(T x,
                 T y)
        Indicates whether two (possibly null) objects are "equal", i.e. they are both null, or not null with x.equals(y).

        Typical usage:
         public class Example {
     private ... x;
     private ... y;
     private ... z;

     public boolean equals(Object obj) {
         if (this == obj) {
             return true;
         }
         if (obj instanceof Example) {
             final Example that = (Example)obj;
             return Nullables.equals(x, that.x) &&
                    Nullables.equals(y, that.y) &&
                    Nullables.equals(z, that.z);
         }
         return false;
     }
 }

      • equalsNotNull

        public static <T> boolean equalsNotNull(T x,
                        T y)
        Indicates whether two (possibly null) objects are strictly not null with x.equals(y).

      • equalsOrNull

        public static <T> boolean equalsOrNull(T x,
                       T y)
        Indicates whether any of two objects is null or x.equals(y).

      • asString

        public static <T> String asString(T obj)
        Converts object to String if not null, returns null otherwise.

      • asStringOrEmpty

        public static <T> String asStringOrEmpty(T obj)
        Converts object to String if not null, returns an empty String otherwise.

      • compareToWithNullsFirst

        public static <T extends Comparable<T>> int compareToWithNullsFirst(T x,
                                                    T y)
        Compares two (possibly null) objects, i.e. it's similar to x.compareTo(y) except it supports null values, assuming that null is lower than any object.

      • compareToWithNullsLast

        public static <T extends Comparable<T>> int compareToWithNullsLast(T x,
                                                   T y)
        Compares two (possibly null) objects, i.e. it's similar to x.compareTo(y) except it supports null values, assuming that null is greater than any object.
